content.raw:
Hi,

I'm a HAPTIX collaborator using the HAPTIX-Gazebo simulation to do some EMG modelling.  I would like to run Gazebo in a VM, (I'm currently using VMWare workstation 12) and develop the code that will be controlling the simulation on my host PC, a Linux PC (Ubuntu 17.04).

I followed the instructions to install and run Gazebo from here: http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?cat=haptix&tut=haptix_install
As such, I used Ubuntu 14.04.  This is running on the Guest.

I can't seem to get the multicast setup correctly with VMWare, thus I can't control the simulation from the host.  

However, I can control the limb without any trouble locally (to the guest).  

Do you guys have experience with this kind of setup, using a VM as opposed to a multicast network appliance.

I would be happy to install Gazebo on my host PC but I was concerned that the haptix communication was dependent on this particular version of Gazebo.

Thanks,

Elliott
